commitResults.messageBody:
Finished requirement for level 1.

Duke now starts by greeting the user, then echos commands entered by the user,
and exits when the user types `bye`.

Add the ability to store whatever text entered by the user
and display them back to the user when requested.

1. Level-3 feature: add the ability to mark tasks as done.
2. Handle two errors when implementing the function of add/mark task as done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix minor format issues for level-3 feature implementation

commitResults.messageBody:
Add support for tracking three types of tasks:
1. ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it
2. Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time
3. Events: tasks that start at a specific time and ends at a specific time

Coming up:
1. A lot of error and exception handling is needed :(

Handle errors when user enters incorrect inputs.  For example (not exclusive):
1. When users create a todo without providing a description.
2. When users enters a command word which is not supported by the current iteration of duke
Add support for deleting tasks from the list.

* (Incomplete) Add A-TextUiTesting

Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Duke.

* (Complete for this iteration) Add A-TextUiTesting

Extend input and expected to test all functionalities and exceptions designed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug for incorrect display of the status icon

commitResults.messageBody:
Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes.
Load the data from the hard disk when Duke starts up.
Filename and file location is hard coded to src/main/java/duke/data/duke.txt

Achieve minimal goal.
1. Store deadline dates as a java.time.LocalDate.
2. Accept dates in "yyyy-mm-dd" format and print in "MMM dd yyyy"
3. Any invalid input or other format will be caught as an exception

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug when merging branch-level-7 and branch-level-8 to master
commitResults.messageBody: Saving and accepting date as input for deadline are now working.

Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes.
Ui: deals with interactions with the user
Storage: deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
Parser: deals with making sense of the user command
TaskList: contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list

To be done:
Seperate tasklists from storage
Avoid using static storage for commands

Disclaimer: this commit is heavily referenced to the folder structure and coding style of se-edu/addressbook-level2

commitResults.messageTitle: Add disclaimer for folder structure and code style reference

commitResults.messageBody: Add JUnit test for Task and Todo class, very simple examples as a start to learn about testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadocs for all public classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody: Todo: add javadocs for the classes for testing.
Tweak the code to comply with a given coding standard.
Allows users to find a task by searching for a keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Gradle Support and fixed checkstyle errors found
commitResults.messageBody:
Current version of the project is compatible with gradle for more automation.

Gradle support can be added and code style can be rectified.

Let's add the support and fix the checkstyle issues

The current version only supports CLI.

GUI supports can be added.

Let's add GUI support!

Something that may be improved:
1. Fix issues of dispalying incomplete list when the list is very long
2. Better organisation of code with load ui and storage for gui

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug of shortened display of list

commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline, event, todo, tasklist are not under package task. Exception is also in the same package with non-relevant classes.

Regroup and rename relevant classes together.

Assertions are added to check when tasks are created and their information stored,
the relevant information such as description, completion date(if applicable) are present.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor for a better code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Codes can be adjusted to fit the code quality as required.

Try to follow various code quality requirements,
including SLAP, no arrow head, better readability, better name for variables and functions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update name of UI to Ui to follow coding standard
Fix building error for I/O testing

commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline should be able to be updated given a new by date

Now deadlines can be updated with a new by date (without being deleted and recreated)
syntax is as follows: "update 1 2020-01-01"
1 is the index of the deadline to be updated as according to the list
2020-01-01 is the new by date in yyyy-mm-dd format

Background and user images can be changed.
Dialogs can be further away from the user or duke image.

Add background image and change the duke and user profile image.
Paddings are added to adjust the dialogs.
Makes the description of the updateCommand more specific.

User guide can be added to the project.

Adds user guide.
Fix checkstyle issues detected by not having '+' on a new line

commitResults.messageTitle: Update image quality and add explanation for exit
Modify codes for better code quality

Codes can be improved for better quality.
